info.game_comments:
2016 Power Players Week game 4.
From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

(1, 1).clue: At a 1986 summit in Iceland, Ronald Reagan & this Russian leader met to continue historic talks on reducing nukes

(2, 1).clue: No beans about it: for your first challenge, you'll be making (what else?) this dish that Texans call a "bowl of red"

(3, 1).clue: When this lifeguard series premiered, it used the appropriate theme "Save Me"

(6, 1).clue: A change in restrictions in 2015 means traveling to this nearby country is now legal for most Americans

(1, 2).clue: On May 22, 1980 Namco began gobbling up the competition by releasing this video game

(2, 2).clue: Start slicing & dicing for some stir-fry made in this Chinese bowl-shaped pan

(3, 2).clue: This title TV family lived on Stone Cave Road

(6, 2).clue: In 2016 New York became the last state to legalize MMA, the sport of "mixed" these

(1, 3).clue: A historic 1989 event in this Asian plaza is also called the June 4th Incident

(2, 3).clue: Be creative & use lima beans instead of chickpeas to make this Middle Eastern pita shmear

(3, 3).clue: "The Drew Carey Show" used the theme songs "5 O'Clock World" & this Ohio city "Rocks"

(6, 3).clue: In 1985 a court in Virginia recognized this as a religion; a few centuries back, it got you hanged

(1, 4).clue: A commander of Panama's National Guard, he promoted himself to general in 1983 & life was good for him... for a while

(2, 4).clue: Prepare your paella, but don't waste any of this yellowish spice, the most expensive in the world

(3, 4).clue: This 1960s TV comedy put a spell on viewers

(6, 4).clue: In 2012 Washington & this other U.S. state legalized recreational marijuana use

(1, 5).clue: In 1982 artificial heart recipient Barney Clark survived 112 days with a device called this-7

(2, 5).clue: For dessert you'll be making Italian cheesecake with this, meaning "recooked" in Italian

(3, 5).clue: "Married... with Children" used Frank Sinatra's version of this song

(1, 1).clue: In 1829 Santa Anna became a hero after putting an end to this country's attempt to reclaim Mexico

(2, 1).clue: After playing the Sundance Kid, this actor charmed in 1972's satirical "The Candidate"

(4, 1).clue: This Cabinet dept. is responsible for conserving the country's land, water, minerals, fish & wildlife

(5, 1).clue: Let's party with former New Mexico governor Gary Johnson, standard bearer for this party in 2012

(6, 1).clue: (I'm Rachel Maddow of MSNBC.)  On November 6, 2015 I moderated the first in the South Democratic Candidates Forum, asking these 3 politicians how they'd fix the party's fortunes in the South
(6, 1).correct response: Hillary Clinton, Bernie Sanders & Martin O\'Malley

(1, 2).clue: On March 6, 1836 this ex-Tennessee congressman lost his life to Santa Anna's army

(2, 2).clue: Jimmy Stewart is a naive senator who launches a filibuster in this Capra classic

(4, 2).clue: A conservative this 8-letter word is a lowball judgment of an amount or value

(5, 2).clue: A toilet in the Palm Springs home of this late flamboyant piano player was made to look like an actual throne

(6, 2).clue: Judy Woodruff was the moderator when this man told Dan Quayle, "you're no Jack Kennedy"

(1, 3).clue: In exile on Staten Island, Santa Anna brought chicle to the U.S., helping start America's affair with this chewy stuff

(2, 3).clue: This Ryan Gosling political thriller shares its name with the last day of Julius Caesar's life

(4, 3).clue: Dress conservatively to see the Queen in a meeting called this, also a word for a theater crowd

(5, 3).clue: Around 1970 it was the common 2-word name for what today we just call feminism

(6, 3).clue: For Ford & Carter on Oct. 22, 1976, "The View" from their podiums was of this ABC newswoman, the moderator

(2, 4).clue: "You can't fight in here--this is the War Room", says President Merkin Muffley in this Kubrick film

(4, 4).clue: Helmholtz gave us the law of conservation of this, also what you do when you take it easy at the start of a long run

(5, 4).clue: This country's first & only monarch was King Idris, who was deposed in 1969

(6, 4).clue: This PBS anchor moderated nearly a dozen presidential debates, including Obama v. McCain & W. v. Kerry

(2, 5).clue: Dustin Hoffman & Robert de Niro cook up a war in Albania in this "canine" comedy

(4, 5).clue: "Conserv"ative name for a music school; New York's Juilliard is a famed one

(5, 5).clue: Term for the words to an opera; Venetian poet Lorenzo da Ponte wrote the one for Mozart's "Don Giovanni"

(6, 5).clue: Quincy Howe moderated a 1956 primary debate between Estes Kefauver & this eventual Dem. nominee

(0, 0).clue: In 2013 President Obama was sworn in on 2 Bibles--one was Lincoln’s & one belonged to this man who died 103 years after Lincoln
